channel.title: What do you think about the American Pledge?
channel.description: What do you guys think about the pledge how it says "Under god" and how the coins say "In god we trust". I think it is a little be racist and i don't really belive(sp?) in god that's just my opion.

item.title: What do you think about the American Pledge?

quoting slayer in the song “cult”

in god i distrust

the date was may 2006
bush was the us president
america was number one
and runescape was unhackable

item.title: What do you think about the American Pledge?
item.dc:creator: @BlackThursday BlackThursday
item.description:
@BlackThursday wrote:

[quote=“Taylor, post:80, topic:1348”][quote author=Teh Freak link=topic=1341.msg58112#msg58112 date=1152121961]
Praying in school isnt allowed, you have no rights on school grounds, they can do whatever they want, so you’re “Freedom of religion” is just a no, you can be searched anytime, this is also why you cant say anything obscene in school, or express your opinion on something unless told to. many cases have proven this, i forget the one where the girl was searched and they sued and the school won <3, maybe pd remembers.
[/quote]praying in schools is allowed in some schools…[/quote]

BEFORE school hours. Im sorry a school is an extension of the state and church should be out of it. I dont need devout cristians praying in front of me at school in the morning… that jus pisses me off.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Bebemycat2 Bebe
item.description:
@Bebemycat2 wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:65, topic:1348”]Our country was founded by rich white Christians, and if we have to pay tribute to their religious tradiition with a few small scratches on our coins and a few words in our pledge, then that’s fine by me, and if you’re offended by it, then there are plenty of other countries to which you can move.[/quote]Actuly it was Protestants

Think of it this way:
WASP

White Anglo-Saxton Protestant

Thats the formula for success in America.

item.description:
@pistolbob wrote:

wow do you all not get it? the pledge was fucking made so that the US would be more patriotic. And honor the men and woman that have fought so we could say those things and not get slaped in the back of the head or even shot. And for the russian fuck above if it wasnt for us you would have lost more then you did in world war II you lost 6 million taking berlin as we were sitting outside waiting for you to get there because you wanted it. fucking commies dont know how to fight.

item.title: What do you think about the American Pledge?
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:73, topic:1348”][quote=ipl0x]
then we should be allowed to pray everyday at school, same thing in some ways.
[/quote]

Nobodies stopping you. I bet if you asked you could even get your own private room anytime you wanted. So shut up.

I find it a bit too dramatic and pointless talking to a flag everyday. [I prefer praying to God over a flag

It is not “Talking to a flag”, it is much less, and much more than that, and I’m not going to explain it to you, because if you don’t get it, you won’t get it. You’re right in that you’re problem is not that you’re too young…;)[/quote]

…? Private room would be quite nice. [if my school could afford it]

You're right in that you're problem is not that you're too young.....;)

lol, good comback, people are stupid in their own ways…

item.source: What do you think about the American Pledge?

item.title: What do you think about the American Pledge?
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

[quote=“PaulT, post:71, topic:1348”][quote author=ipl0x link=topic=1341.msg33011#msg33011 date=1147929832]
I am a pure Russian and I find the American Pledge a bit too dramatic in how Americans say it everyday in school, I refuse to even say it once, I find it silly and childish.[/quote]

I agree, it’s pretty pointless. That’s why I say it anyway. It’s not like it’s a binding contract that says you support everything America is doing in the world, it’s just a silly flag. So if it gets the Man off your back, why not just do it and look normal? I think your just too lazy to stand up

[quote] To me “talking” to a flag sounds and looks stupid, yes I understand that it’s a good thing in it’s own ways but it’s a little overdone since American Schools do it every day.
[/quote]

A lot of traditions seem stupid to kids. Get over it.[/quote]

Firstly we aliens are bound by law to say the pledge when we get our citizanship. And I am not too lazy to stand up, I just told you that I find it a bit too dramatic and pointless talking to a flag everyday. [I prefer praying to God over a flag]

Secondly I am not a little kid, I believe in the fact that it does look great how America puts attention into that, just that fact that it does not have to be an everyday thing, if they want it that way then we should be allowed to pray everyday at school, same thing in some ways.

Read full topic
item.source: What do you think about the American Pledge?

item.title: What do you think about the American Pledge?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

ipl0x:

I am a pure Russian and I find the American Pledge a bit too dramatic in how Americans say it everyday in school, I refuse to even say it once, I find it silly and childish.

I agree, it’s pretty pointless. That’s why I say it anyway. It’s not like it’s a binding contract that says you support everything America is doing in the world, it’s just a silly flag. So if it gets the Man off your back, why not just do it and look normal? I think your just too lazy to stand up

To me "talking" to a flag sounds and looks stupid, yes I understand that it's a good thing in it's own ways but it's a little overdone since American Schools do it every day.

A lot of traditions seem stupid to kids. Get over it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

PaulT:

[quote]I didn’t say it’s “harmful”

I didn’t say that you said it was harmful.

[quote]
and before taking out a “part” of my post please read the rest of my opinion before trying to make it sound stupid through that one part.[/quote]

I read your whole post, but it seemed pretty directionless except for the part I quoted.[/quote]

Then you must have pretty bad attention skills

item.title: What do you think about the American Pledge?
item.dc:creator: @ipl0x ipl0x
item.description:
@ipl0x wrote:

PaulT:

[quote]To me “talking” to a flag sounds and looks stupid

To me, talking into a cell phone looks and sounds stupid. I hate cell phones, and the people who talk into them as if nobody exists around them. Cell phones have caused more deaths and discomfort than the pledge ever has. My point is, that the pledge is basically harmless, even if it is stupid.[/quote]

I didn’t say it’s “harmful” and before taking out a “part” of my post please read the rest of my opinion before trying to make it sound stupid through that one part.

Read full topic
